intro: Trachyozus, commonly known as the roughleaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its rough, textured leaves and showy, often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, well-drained soils. Trachyozus species are often used in ornamental horticulture due to their attractive foliage and blooms. Botanically, they exhibit a variety of growth forms, including shrubs and small trees.
